授業目的: This course focuses on the subject of multiculturalism, how to think about the issues and learn about the diverse phenomena that occur within societies that are composed of plural communities and ethnic identities. Students will be introduced to key concepts, such as, "culture," "ethnicity," "diaspora" and "prejudice/discrimination." Also, considerations of the "modern" nature of multicultural consciousness, and the local ramifications brought about by global trends, especially the movement of people across national borders will be studied.

特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: In accordance to KGU guidelines (at the time of this submission) classes will be conducted by in-classroom Face to face format. Classes will consist of lectures and discussion on assigned readings of pertinent articles and texts (in translation). If class size permits students will be asked to make presentations. Also, field trips to places related to course content may be planned. Language of instruction, English.

第1回:
((Concerning Course Outline))

(Depending on how discussions proceed, the following topics may be introduced in a different order, or possibly other topics may be added)

Course introduction. Explanation of course requirements and assignments. Group assignment and presentation topics. Why study multiculturalism? An introductory exercise.
第2回: <Culture> and <cultures>. Working definitions. Why are there so many different societies and people? The dynamics of culture.
第3回: Are you Japanese? Ethnicity, group identities. Characteristics of groups.
第4回: Ways to understand ethnicity, ethnic and minority groups, race and diaspora.
第5回: (Group work. Topics for presentation. Organising research.)
第6回: Prejudice. Reasons, mechanisms and problems to consider.
第7回: Cultural diversity. Why is it important? How do nations deal with diversity?
第8回: (Group work. Group discussions. Progress report. Creation of an outline)
第9回:
Problems in multiculturalism. Nation state building, Plural society or
Assimilation policies. What about the individual?
第10回: Japan’s multicultural policy. Toyonaka city, a case study.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students will be required to prepare and submit short assignments. These are designed to stimulate discussions in the following class sessions. Also, at the end of the course, students will give group presentations. Limited time will be given in class for group preparation work, but there will be a need to work outside of the official class time as well. In addition background readings will be assigned before the course starts that should be read, and in some cases summarized for submission. These will be available for downloading no later than a week before the course starts.
